intro: Corchorus mompoxensis, commonly known as the Mompox dock, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in regions of Colombia and Ecuador. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its herbaceous growth habit. The plant features palmate leaves with lobed margins and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Due to its limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
